description.narrative: To support the effective implementation and UN coherence through the efficient, accountable and transparent administration of the United Nations Development Fund

sector.narrative: Build resilience to shocks and crisis

Although DDS development projects are under operational and financial closure, a work plan October-December 2020 has been submitted to conduct UNDF Projects Final Evaluation as stipulated in the projects document:
1. UNDF project evaluation conducted. 2. UNDF final evaluation report shared with stakeholders and communicated.
1. UNDF project evaluation completed. 2. UNDF final evaluation report disseminated, communicated and shared with stakeholders.
N/A. The project has been operationally closed and no activities planned in 2021.
N/A. The project has been operationally closed and no activities planned in 2021.

1.1 More than 8 locations have more than 6 projects working in the location 1.2 12 coordination meetings held at state level 1.3 SC and Donors report satisfaction with the TS services
2.1 75% of agreed monitoring visits undertaken 2.2 100% positive feedback from donor if the quality of reporting 2.3 100% of TS reports that meet quality standards and timeline for reporting 2.4 All FaST projects are using IREPS for regular reporting
3.1 Donors 100% satisfied with communication/visibility services 3.2 6 external communication materials produced 3.3 500 clicks on the UNDF webpage 3.4 10 lessons learnt/best practices captured
4.1 Vacancies filled within 3 months 4.2 100% of projects comply with funds rules and regulations 4.3 Average time to disperse funds from MPTF is 10 days

Output 1: Effective and regular coordination for UNDF projects and stakeholders established and ensured
1.1 Progress on track - More than 8 locations have more than 6 projects working in the location 1.2 Progress on track 3 photography workshops 1 x state evaluation workshop ND 10 state coordination meetings
1.3 Progress on track SC and Donors report satisfaction with the TS services
Output 2: UNDF Projects progress is regularly monitored, evaluated and reported
2.1 Progress on track - 100% planned monitoring visits undertaken 2.2 Progress on track - 100% positive feedback from donor on the quality of reporting 2.3 Progress on track - 100% of TS reports that meet quality standards and timeline for reporting 4 x quarterly narrative reports submitted 2 x 6 monthly financial reports submitted 4 X At a Glance cumulative document produced in English and Arabic
2.4 Not on track but modified as due to technical problem with the site, UNDF TS has updated this manually
Output 3: High visibility of and communication about UNDF projects is displayed
3.1 On track donors are satisfied with communication/visibility services 3.2 On track numerous external communication materials produced: Social media posts on twitter and Facebook - 3 per week Photo of the week produced every Sunday 4 x At a Glance documents produced in both Arabic and English Darfur Donor Mapping data collected and maps produced and shared 7 Videos produced 1 website designed and to be launched in January/February 2019 (English/Arabic)
3.3 500 clicks on the UNDF webpage (xxx followers on Twitter/FB) 3.4 Information for lessons learnt have been captured thorugh discussions with partners, final document to be produced early 2019
Output 4: Efficient, systematic and cost conscious Fund Management established
4.1 NUNV and Intern recruited within time anticipated 4.2 Projects have complied with funds rules and regulations, but will be further analyzed in early 2019 4.3 Average time to disperse funds from MPTF is 10 days
